title: Customer Service Value in Marketing Analytics
headline: Learn how to use customer service value in marketing analytics as well as customer churn from this free online course.
description: Customer Service Value in Marketing Analytics is a free online course that offers an in-depth understanding of customer service value as well as the importance of the customer churn approach in marketing analytics. You will learn about the various nuances that can be used to predict customer churning behaviour and also study the use of text mining in digital marketing.

courseDescription:
Customer Service Value in Marketing Analytics is a free online course that offers a comprehensive guide to understanding the importance of the customer churn approach in marketing. This course will teach you how various techniques can be used to predict customer-churning behaviour in marketing analytics. It begins with an analysis of customer service control, and how it can be used to solve real-life problems.

Next, you will learn about text mining, as well as the impact of Internet availability on the analytics process. You will also study the features and application of natural language processing in analytics, as well as the roles of information and digital technologies. Then you will discuss the features of tokenization, as well as how to use the mining natural language processing approach in marketing. Analyze the customer lifetime value approach, as well as studying how to maintain a relationship with customers. Finally, you will grapple with customer relationship management, as well as the other features of the economics of CRM in marketing analytics.

This free online course provides practical knowledge and numerous applications like spam detection in text mining and sentiment analytics, as well as how to use the naive Bayes classifier algorithm for the spam detection process. This course will be of significant interest to business organizations, programmers and anyone interested in using marketing analytics for private or professional e-commerce.

Start Course Now

Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

  • Lesson Summary
    • Regression and conjoint are examples of marketing analysis used to measure consumers demand
    • Customers can be divided into multiple groups based on their preferences and behavior
    • Customer churn is the percentage of customers that stopped using your company's production service during a certain time
    •  Pivot is a table of statistic that summarizes the data of a more extensive table
    • In Consumer switching, when the retailer becomes the pool maker in some product categories, the negotiation power of the retailers goes up
    • In Consumer switching, Promotion means: if the average case price is 0.045 while the promotion is ongoing, it gives around 20% discount
    • In customer lifetime value, Function str ()is a company way to display the structure of an R object
    • The Maximum likelihood methods are used to fit data in logistic regression
    • ROC curves are commonly used to characterize the sensitivity trade soft for a binary classifier
    • Net present value is the difference between the present value of cash inflows and the value of cash outflows over a period
  • Learning Outcomes 
  • Upon completion of this module, you should be able to: 
    • Explain the concept of text mining and the impact of internet availability 
    • List the features of tokenization and mining natural language processing approach
    • Outline the features of text mining and sentiment analysis 
    • Summarize how to create a bar plot that will show the most common word
    • Evaluate the application of spam detection in text mining and sentiment analytics
    • Discuss how to use the Naive Baye's algorithm for spam detection

  • Lesson Summary 
    • Text analytics is the process of deriving high-quality information from text
    • Classification and regression, Characterization and discrimination, as well as Clustering and analysis are forms of data mining functionality
    • Natural language processing is concerned with the interactions between computers and human languages on how to program computers to process and analyze data
    • Tokens have the term frequency and inverted document frequency which describe the word that is more important
    • A frequency is a measure of the importance of a term in the document
    • Corpus is a collection of text document that can apply text mining or natural language routined to derive inferences
    • VectorSource() takes a grouping of texts and makes each element of the resulting vector a document within your R workspace
    • Stemming is an important technique for processing data which is used to identify the root word for actual words
    • Demand mining is the actual discovery phase of a knowledge
